Dialogue1: ^"Felix, how did you manage to escape from prison?"
^"I'm done playing your games, Morbius. Foxhaven will be free from your tyranny."
^"You may have taken my power, but you won't take my spirit."

c-0: ^determined "I'm done playing your games, Morbius. Foxhaven will be free from your tyranny."
c-1: ^defiant "You may have taken my power, but you won't take my spirit."

Dialogue2: ^"You were once so sure of your power, Felix. What changed?"
^"True strength comes from using power for good, not domination."
^"I've grown tired of being the villain in my own story."

c-0: ^solemn "True strength comes from using power for good, not domination."
c-1: ^determined "I've grown tired of being the villain in my own story."

Dialogue3: ^"And you think you can defeat me, Felix? You're just a mere mortal now."
^"I may be mortal, but I have the power of redemption. And with it, I'll triumph over your darkness."
^"Maybe I'm just a mortal, but I have the will to fight for what's right. And with my power restored, justice will prevail."

c-0: ^with conviction "I may be mortal, but I have the power of redemption. And with it, I'll triumph over your darkness."
c-1: ^with determination "Maybe I'm just a mortal, but I have the will to fight for what's right. And with my power restored, justice will prevail."

Dialogue4: ^"Is that so, Felix? What power do you speak of?"
^"The power you failed to take into account, Morbius. My flames, once extinguished, now burn brighter than ever."
^"My flames have returned, stronger than before. And they're here to bring your darkness to an end."

c-0: ^smirking "The power you failed to take into account, Morbius. My flames, once extinguished, now burn brighter than ever."
c-1: ^grinning "My flames have returned, stronger than before. And they're here to bring your darkness to an end."

Dialogue5: ^"My power lies not just in flames, Morbius, but in the choice to wield them for good."
^"You forgot one thing - the power of redemption. And now, it's your turn to feel its heat."

c-0: ^confidently "My power lies not just in flames, Morbius, but in the choice to wield them for good."
c-1: ^defiantly "You forgot one thing - the power of redemption. And now, it's your turn to feel its heat."

Dialogue6: ^Let's end this for once and all....
